summary: UCLA is a top public research university in Los Angeles, California. It was first established in 1881 as a teacher's college and later became part of the University of California system in 1919. UCLA offers a wide range of degree programs and is known for its excellent academics and sports teams, called the Bruins. The university has a successful athletic history, winning many NCAA championships and Olympic medals. UCLA is also home to many talented faculty and alumni, including Nobel laureates, Rhodes scholars, and Pulitzer prize winners.
title: University of California, Los Angeles
